qas.question: How many tons of bitumen ere produced in 1984?
What boiling point is considered to be the for asphalt?
What method is used to divide asphalt from other materials?
What is the process used to harden the asphalt?
In processing asphalt, what is the unit used to separate it?
How many tons were produced in 1927?
About 30,000,000 tons were produced in what year?
What is material with a boiling point over 200 degrees Celsius considered?
Asphalt is considered material with a freezing point below how many degrees?
Which step makes the product less viscous and softer?

context: <b5_0>About <a0_0>40,000,000<b5_0/><a0_0/> tons were produced in <b6_0>1984<b6_0/>[needs update]. It is obtained as the "heavy" (i.e., difficult to distill) fraction. Material with a boiling point greater than around <a1_0><b8_0>500 °C<b8_0/><a1_0/> is considered <b7_0>asphalt<b7_0/>. <a2_0>Vacuum distillation<a2_0/> separates it from the other components in crude oil (such as naphtha, gasoline and diesel). The resulting material is typically further treated to extract small but valuable amounts of lubricants and to adjust the properties of the material to suit applications. In a <a4_0>de-asphalting<a4_0/> unit, the crude asphalt is treated with either propane or butane in a supercritical phase to extract the lighter molecules, which are then separated. Further processing is possible by "<a3_0>blowing<a3_0/>" the product: namely <b9_0>reacting it with oxygen<b9_0/>. This step makes the product harder and more viscous.
